text: How to add a topic to our blog post?
I was not able to find any fields to add topic there was only field to add Tags, Are they same ?
Also, Is it possible to add a custom module having (Most Recent | Popular | Tags etc) as a post filter
We are new to Hubl and working on a client's blog template. Client does not have website add-on.
Also Is there a way to bring in client's template to our trial account to experiment on it.
and We are having trouble adding related posts at the bottom of blog posts.

- Tags are the same, unless you create a custom field for topics.
- You would need to build the custom filter/module, but yes it is possible
- HubSpot wonâ€™t migrate the template to the trial account but you should be able to if you are versed in HTML/CSS and follow the documentation. We can also help if needed
- How are you trying to add the related posts/what is the trouble?

`escapejson` never seems to do what I expect it to do. I think I'm expecting for either `var jsObject = {{ object | escapejson }}` or `var jsObject = JSON.parse({{object | escapejson}})` to work, where `object` is a object-like in the template context. 

Is this how it's used? Or is it only intended to serialize values, not objects?

Documentation on <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-filters> seems to suggest the latter (it serializes strings, not objects) but I'm having a hard time imagining how that's useful
So is there a way to serialize an object as JSON using HUBL?

<@U98RGFUQZ> We tried adding this 

<https://designers.HubSpot.com/tutorials/creating-a-related-post-section-with-hubl>

to our Blog Content : post template file, but it seems to be not working. We were not able to find "content.topic_list" in our template. Thank You
One more thing, we need a post filter some what like this <https://www.helpscout.net/blog/> , is this custom made?
